definitions.definition: the act of officially removing somebody from their job, school, team, etc. for a period of time, usually as a punishment

examples.text: The two players are appealing against their suspensions.
Another caution will result in his automatic suspension from the final.
The athlete could face a lengthy period of suspension if found guilty.
a detective under suspension from his job
He incurred a suspension on reduced pay.
He is serving a one-match suspension.

definitions.definition: the act of delaying something for a period of time, until a decision has been taken

examples.text: These events have led to the suspension of talks.
Many movies require the viewer to engage in a willing suspension of disbelief.

definitions.definition: the system of springs, etc. by which a vehicle is supported on its wheels and that makes it more comfortable to ride in when the road surface is not even

examples.text: The new model is fitted with computer-controlled suspension.

definitions.definition: a liquid with very small pieces of solid matter floating in it; the state of such a liquid

examples.text: The suspension was passed through a filter to separate out the solid particles.
The material carried in suspension by the tide is deposited on the shore.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from French, or from Latin suspensio(n-), from the verb suspendere, from sub- ‘from below’ + pendere ‘hang’.
